<p> Collision detects camera-to-object contact using current view and NavigationInfo avatarSize. Collision is a Grouping node that handles collision detection for its children. Collision can contain a single proxy child node for substitute collision-detection geometry. <i>Hint:</i> proxy shapes are not rendered and remain invisible. </p> <p> X3D Tooltips of interest: <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/tooltips/X3dTooltips.html#Collision" target="_blank">Collision</a>. </p> <p> <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/Architecture.html" target="_blank">X3D Specification</a> sections of interest: <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/navigation.html" target="_blank">23 Navigation component</a>, <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/navigation.html#Concepts" target="_blank">23.2 Concepts</a> and <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/navigation.html#Collision" target="_blank">23.4.2 Collision</a>. </p> <p> <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dResources.html#Examples" target="_blank">X3D Examples Archives</a> of related interest: </p> <ul> <li> VRML 2 Sourcebook:&nbsp; <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/Vrml2Sourcebook/Chapter27SensingVisibilityProximityCollision" target="_blank">Chapter 27 Sensing Visibility Proximity Collision</a> </li> <li> X3D for Web Authors: <a href="http://x3dgraphics.com/examples/X3dForWebAuthors/Chapter04ViewingNavigation" target="_blank">Chapter 04 Viewing Navigation</a> </li> </ul>
